Details: Both agents provide comprehensive analyses of SSIS to Python conversion with high semantic alignment (85/100) and moderate structural differences (72/100). Agent_Summary offers concise executive-style reporting while Agent_Detailed provides systematic numbered sections. Both outputs address identical core objectives: analyzing SSIS package conversion accuracy, identifying discrepancies, providing optimization suggestions, and delivering recommendations. Key semantic alignments include: (1) Both recognize successful conversion of control flow tasks to Python functions (lines 6-7 in Agent_Summary, lines 15-16 in Agent_Detailed), (2) Both identify data flow component replication using pandas/PySpark operations (lines 8-9 in Agent_Summary, lines 17-18 in Agent_Detailed), (3) Both highlight error handling differences between SSIS event handlers and Python try-except blocks (lines 12-13 in Agent_Summary, lines 25-26 in Agent_Detailed), (4) Both recommend performance optimization through parallel processing (lines 18-19 in Agent_Summary, lines 35-36 in Agent_Detailed). Minor semantic divergence occurs in emphasis: Agent_Summary focuses on business logic preservation while Agent_Detailed emphasizes technical implementation details.

Agent_Detailed employs systematic numbered structure: 1. Summary, 2. Conversion Accuracy, 3. Discrepancies and Issues, 4. Optimization Suggestions, 5. Overall Assessment, 6. Recommendations, 7. API Cost (lines 1-85). Both follow logical ETL analysis flow but differ in presentation style.
